findings.lung: Mild bibasilar atelectasis, small bilateral pleural effusions, mild nondependent subpleural lung changes suggesting an interstitial process.
findings.liver: Small scattered hypodensities throughout, likely benign; enhances homogeneously with no focal hepatic lesions.
findings.gallbladder: Layering high attenuation material in the gallbladder lumen.
findings.kidneys: Enhance and excrete contrast without evidence of hydronephrosis or masses; right kidney unremarkable; parapelvic cyst on the left.
findings.abdominal wall: Midline incision present with small inflammatory changes and subcutaneous air.
findings.postoperative: Significant reduction in inflammatory changes and phlegmon in the right lower abdomen and pelvis since prior examination, presence of several intraperitoneal pockets of extraluminal air.
findings.aorta: Moderate atherosclerotic calcifications, patent celiac axis, SMA, bilateral renal arteries.
findings.pelvis: Mild pelvic free fluid, normal urinary bladder and ureters; no pelvic or inguinal lymph node enlargement.
findings.osseous: Moderate degenerative changes at L2-L3 and L5-S1; no suspicious lesions.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant reduction in the extent of inflammatory changes and phlegmon in the right lower abdomen and pelvis since prior examination.
